Radiation therapy involves the use of ionizing radiation in an attempt to either cure or improve symptoms. It works by damaging the DNA of cancerous tissue, causing mitotic catastrophe resulting in the death of the cancer cells. To spare normal tissues, shaped radiation beams are aimed from multiple exposure angles to intersect at the tumor, providing a much larger dose there than in the surrounding, healthy tissue. respond: Abnormal impulses that cause arrhythmia can begin by one of three mechanisms: automaticity, re-entry, or triggered activity. Arrhythmias due to automaticity are the result of an abnormal increase in the rate of spontaneous depolarization of a normal non-pacemaker cell. Arrhythmias due to re-entry are the result of a wave of depolarization that re-enters tissue that it has already passed through, while triggered activity refers to a small group of cells that spontaneously depolarize after a normal depolarization.

respond: The virus enters the cell by binding to NTCP on the surface and being endocytosed. It multiplies via RNA made by a host enzyme and transfers its genomic DNA to the cell nucleus. context_3: The treatment for autoimmune hepatitis consists of two phases, an initial and maintenance phase. The initial phase consists of higher doses of corticosteroids which are tapered down over a number of weeks to a lower dose. If used in combination, azathioprine is given during the initial phase as well. Once the initial phase has been completed, a maintenance phase that consists of lower dose corticosteroids, and in combination therapy, azathioprine until liver blood markers are normalized. Treatment results in 66-91% of patients achieving normal liver test values in two years, with the average being 22 months.

context_3: Certainly. To diagnose Hepatitis C, a positive test is followed by a confirmatory test. The immunoassay is verified using a recombinant immunoblot assay. If there is no RNA but the immunoblot is positive, it means the person had a previous infection that cleared, either with treatment or spontaneously. Point-of-care testing is also available for quicker results.
